item.title: I want to emphasize that point 3 and 5 go hand in hand 🤝 Just because you’ve gained confidence, doesn’t mean you should slack on awareness or safety! It just feels more second nature 💗 Ultimately, being short does make learning to ride a little more chall

item.title: why is it that I actively avoid eye contact when I’m driving in a cage, but on a bike, suddenly everyone is a friend? 🤪🤪 HIIIIIIYOOOOOOO 👋👋👋 cardo code: motophie saint code: motophie . . . . . #Motorcycle #motorcyclegear #motogirl #shortriders #motorcycle

item.title: there’s obviously a lot more that can be said, but I’m hoping this super general guide can still help some of you shorter girlies also wanting to ride for the first time!! 🩵🎀 save for later if you have brain rot 🤪 love you 🧸 . . . . . #Motorcycle #motorcy

item.title: here’s a reminder to practice slow speed manoeuvres and drills as much as you can (even if you have your full license!) 💗 I recently dropped my bike for the first time in a long time, turning onto a footpath to park (legal here btw) 😮‍💨 it was a reminder
item.description: here’s a reminder to practice slow speed manoeuvres and drills as much as you can (even if you have your full license!) 💗 I recently dropped my bike for the first time in a long time, turning onto a footpath to park (legal here btw) 😮‍💨 it was a reminder
item.author: motophie

item.title: After security spoke to us, a random couple in a car drove up to us and asked whether we got kicked out. I told them what happened and they said “if not here, then where? On the road?! I’ll go talk to the security” 🤣 I said it was fine, that we understood

item.title: my cadence when yapping and riding is so odd 🤣 i dont know how vloggers can be so well spoken while riding HAHA Im using my cardo packtalk edge to record my voice here 🎙️ You can use code MOTOPHIE for $ off your cardo 💗 . . . . #Motorcycle #motorcyclegear

item.title: documenting my noob arc for everyone to laugh at 😅 there are actually so many more things I’ve learned / still learning over the last year but these were the first 3 that came to mind: 1️⃣ lane positioning 2️⃣ shifting with intention 3️⃣ don’t grab the f
item.description: documenting my noob arc for everyone to laugh at 😅 there are actually so many more things I’ve learned / still learning over the last year but these were the first 3 that came to mind: 1️⃣ lane positioning 2️⃣ shifting with intention 3️⃣ don’t grab the f

item.title: I’ve fuelled up here plenty of times and this is the first time I’ve been asked to take my helmet off before fuelling. The fuel was already flowing before it stopped completely so I was super confused 🤣 there are only signs that you need to get off your

item.title: when they said riding is the best form of therapy, they weren’t joking 🍃 ive been such a people pleaser my whole life, it was always hard to know what I truly wanted deep down. but riding has given me a sense of freedom and independence I’ve never felt be

item.title: some of my favourite accessories as a newer rider that helped me feel safer on the road 🏍️✨ - Frame sliders • Oggy Knobs from Bikebiz - Helmet Light • by Brake Free from Fender Eliminator - Sun Reactive Pinlock • from EasyR - Bluetooth Headset • Cardo P
item.description: some of my favourite accessories as a newer rider that helped me feel safer on the road 🏍️✨ - Frame sliders • Oggy Knobs from Bikebiz - Helmet Light • by Brake Free from Fender Eliminator - Sun Reactive Pinlock • from EasyR - Bluetooth Headset • Cardo P
